title: bytes: API
body:
NewBuffer says

    In most cases, new(Buffer) (or just declaring a Buffer variable) is
    preferable to NewBuffer. In particular, passing a non-empty buf to
    NewBuffer and then writing to the Buffer will overwrite buf, not append
    to it.

I think that's backward.  It will append to buf, not overwrite it.

For Buffer.Truncate, what happens wen n > len?  Does it panic?
